id1.text:
Hello, Joshua!

Quantum physics is the fundamental theory describing the nature of matter and energy at the atomic and subatomic level, where the familiar rules of classical physics break down. It reveals a bizarre reality where particles can exist in multiple places at once (superposition), become instantaneously linked regardless of distance (entanglement), and act as both waves and particles simultaneously, dictating how everything from light bulbs to lasers, and even our own bodies, ultimately function.?
